channel.title: Still need help please
channel.description: hey im making a script (only my second script) and i cant figure out how to make it scroll down to the bottom of the page. it an account creator and i need it to scroll down to the bottom of the page to it can click on the "i agree" button. anyone know how?

item.title: Still need help please
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

ok thanks mopman ill try and figure it out then post if it works.

EDIT: ok i reposted the fixed version above(what i think is fixed lol). i still get this error though
Line 35: [Error] (15536:11): Duplicate identifier ‘TYPEBYTE’ in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\includes\SRL\SRL\core\Text.scar

item.title: Still need help please

@Mopman wrote:

You’re missing two begins, and you have one too many ends.

Read full topic

item.title: Still need help please
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

ok ill try that thanks. and why wont this script compile? i just got bored and decided to make it real fast(just tryin to get more famaliar with scripting).
[scar]program AutoLogin;
{.include SRL\SRL.scar}
{.include SRL\SRL\core\Text.scar}

var
ExistUser, Login, x, y: Integer;

//setup lines 11 and 12 and don’t touch anything else
const
UserName =‘username’;//type your username here
Password =‘password’;//type your password here

Procedure ClickExist;
begin
If(FindBitmap(ExistUser, x, y))Then
begin
wait(900)
MoveMouseSmooth(x, y);
wait(900)
ClickMouse(x, y, True);
End;

Procedure TypeIt;
begin
TypeSend(Username);
chr(13)
wait(1000)
TypeSend(Password);
End;

Procedure Finish;
begin
If(FindBitMap(Login, x, y)Then
begin
wait(1000)
MoveMouseSmooth(x, y);
wait(1000)
ClickMouse(x, y, True)
End;

Procedure SetUpBitmaps;
begin
ExistUser := BitmapFromString(22, 14, ‘z78DAA554410EC2300CF’ +
‘BD244DD01C721D6FF3F0969E1E0CA7514440F3EA495EBC456F0C6’ +
‘E807141F383A7003704E18F51CF9A532108EEBF0BFA37094A79D6’ +
‘DE019B8D0E9BA2868D8D2E3FA9A94A4182F2B1AB423EEBA1DED05’ +
‘2C2690BBF98F8682BFCE0BE7A6ABD80C5C9CACFF7B4B3F4E7549F’ +
‘8E42675ED1834037DEFF7BD05E619D6E4B88EA2E238D50BD59027’ +
‘9973E2984B7910972B73D0F4563404B39D0329A97BA1F9FF5543D’ +
‘EA39BFF22ABCE0BB3A302B7C20906B7B53415815A771AA60DC33B’ +
‘C7DD2AF2CB748B2EF67FCEC6BFE7CA2B3A49C3077896A7E4’);

Login := BitmapFromString(26, 18, ‘z78DAB555410EC33008FB525’ +
‘4E8D41D5BADF9FF93263539B822A6B0B51C3820123B60822EBACE’ +
‘AABE9F5475975DAABE9B6F118D9C25B7F53B57D954E5258B96EE5’ +
‘B0451100B23D6FBB81FADF39A786963821E2B60F9FC548153352C’ +
‘AEA903CB19F4C5BCB78285BAC3B030427A67BDDF3BE4560E1B541’ +
‘5585DD4105905D0ED0D887EC1CD4CC74039BE77ABD472D82C0CB8’ +
‘F91A43DC4944B6EE8DDE4E398603BE34C1CDD57C25C6147891EFF’ +
‘6DD721BE8D6A014B0136236FF50269BC148DDFC0ADF108F734B66’ +
‘26E24F7073EFBC811BD94A3560A83D96838A622F62A706FF3C444’ +
‘AC022F94CAB6C16FA29BB9D5B04E336F2C7B64DCC14E2667D76FB’ +
‘9BEEFB7FCB5F4C02DCD84E0FE9F3812AC53DD367FB7BBFF96D775’ +
‘F’);

End;

//Main Loop Below
SetupSRL;
SetUpBitmaps;
ActivateClient;
wait(800 + Random(300));
ClickExist;
TypeIt;
Finish;

End.
[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Still need help please
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

you could use:
procedure HoldMouse(x,y: integer; Left: boolean); - Holds mouse button. Set parameter Left to true for left button, false for right.

procedure ReleaseMouse(x,y: integer; Left: boolean); Releases mouse button.

with a move mouse in between

Read full topic
